alert.note: Alert for Price (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 31 at 3:27AM CDT until April 01 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Storm Warning, heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. For the second Winter Storm Warning, mixed precipitation changing to heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Price County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM CDT this morning. For the second Winter Storm Warning, from 7 PM this evening to 7 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near-blizzard conditions may be possible at times due to the combination of heavy snow and strong winds.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
